title: Ticket #25: Make static char* EMPTY_DESCRIP const
description:
static char* EMPTY_DESCRIP = "<NULL>";

This causes hundreds of warnings from gcc 4.3 because "<NULL>" is a constant string.

Changing it to be const results in errors that go at least as deep as:

void free_descrip(char *p) { if(p && p != EMPTY_DESCRIP) free(p); }

It is rather creepy that the event_descrip on Timer (actually struct tagTimer in condor_timer_manager.h) is not const in this way.
remarks:
2010-May-05 17:15:40 by jfrey:
This code is intended to save the space and time of copying and freeing a default description string for daemon-core's Register_*() methods. I checked a couple daemons and they always supply description strings. So making EMPTY_DESCRIP constant and strdup()ing it shouldn't cause any noticeable overhead.

2010-May-05 17:50:35 by jfrey:
Pushed a fix to master for 7.5.3. EMPTY_DESCRIP is now constant and is strdup()d anytime it's used.

2010-May-06 11:16:03 by jfrey:
Pushed a fix to master for 7.5.3. Compiler warnings about EMPTY_DESCRIP should be gone now.
